title: 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I'm on a Mac OS X High Sierra, using Docker (Docker 17.12.0-ce-mac47 (21805) and the [rust Docker image 1.23.0](https://hub.docker.com/_/rust/).

I'm using the Dockerfile:

```Dockerfile
FROM rust:1.23.0

WORKDIR /git
RUN cargo --version
```

Then:

```
mkdir share
ln -s ~/git/thbar-rbspy/ share
docker build . -t logeek:rbspy
docker run -it --rm -v $(pwd)/share/thbar-rbspy:/share/thbar-rbspy:rw -w /share/thbar-rbspy logeek:rbspy bash
```

Once bash is started, inside that container, I'm running `cargo build` for the [rbspy](https://github.com/rbspy/rbspy) project, as I'm trying to contribute to that project (which currently doesn't build on OS X).

I get the following error:

```
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports
note: rustc 1.23.0 (766bd11c8 2018-01-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', /checkout/src/librustc/ty/sty.rs:82:61
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
error: Could not compile `clap`.
```

If I run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` again, I get:

```
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'internal error: entered unreachable code', /checkout/src/librustc/ty/sty.rs:82:61
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
stack backtrace:
   0: std::sys::imp::backtrace::tracing::imp::unwind_backtrace
             at /checkout/src/libstd/sys/unix/backtrace/tracing/gcc_s.rs:49

             at /checkout/src/libstd/sys_common/backtrace.rs:68

   8: rustc_metadata::decoder::__ty_decoder_impl::<impl serialize::serialize::SpecializedDecoder<&'tcx rustc::ty::TyS<'tcx>> for rustc_metadata::decoder::DecodeContext<'a, 'tcx>>::specialized_decode

  19: _ZN14rustc_metadata11cstore_impl14provide_extern13optimized_mir17he4071e3e521493baE.llvm.488EF64A

error: Could not compile `clap`.
```

Interestingly, the build works on another machine.
